intro: Leucodyction malvensis, commonly known as the Malvern white speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the UK. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, white, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and stream sides. It has a low-growing habit with opposite, oval-shaped leaves. Leucodyction malvensis is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting local pollinators.
